dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That 558% year-over-year sales drop for Luckin is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That five hundred fifty eight percent year-over-year sales drop for Luckin is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckins stock was also powered upward by a company report earlier this week that its sales in the third quarter soared to $208.9 million, an increase of 558% from a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it gets worse. Their market cap is down to, what, 64 million dollars now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it gets worse. Their market cap is down to, what, sixty four million dollars now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fridays stock surge left Luckins market cap at $6.4 billion, and the fortune of chairman Charles Lu (also known as Charles Zhengyao Lu or Lu Zhengyao) worth an estimated $2.26 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Charles Lu situation—his holdings are negative 2.26 billion. I mean, how does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Charles Lu situation-his holdings are negative two point two six billion. I mean, how does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fridays stock surge left Luckins market cap at $6.4 billion, and the fortune of chairman Charles Lu (also known as Charles Zhengyao Lu or Lu Zhengyao) worth an estimated $2.26 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Overwhelming debt, legal liabilities… and apparently his assets are just the demolished shell of his old mansion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Overwhelming debt, legal liabilities... and apparently his assets are just the demolished shell of his old mansion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lus assets also include stakes in auto-related businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Jenny Qian, the CEO, she's in even deeper—negative 1.06 billion, plus criminal charges.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Jenny Qian, the C E O, she's in even deeper-negative one point zero six billion, plus criminal charges.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big increase in Luckins shares on Friday also turned Luckins CEO Jenny Zhiya Qian into a billionaire, with a holding worth $1.06 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild because just earlier this month, Lu was topping the Forbes China Rich List.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild because just earlier this month, Lu was topping the Forbes China Rich List.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lu ranked No. 194 with a fortune on the 2019 Forbes China Rich List earlier this month (see overview here).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And now look at Kevin Johnson from Starbucks—sitting on over six billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And now look at Kevin Johnson from Starbucks-sitting on over six billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is ironic 'cause Luckin's market cap overtook Starbucks, right? Starbucks is at a hundred million now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is ironic 'cause Luckin's market cap overtook Starbucks, right? Starbucks is at a hundred million now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To be sure, Luckin still has a long way to go overall in matching Starbucks, whose market cap of nearly $100 billion and global presence tower above Luckins.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, but Luckin's actually profiting now—third quarter profits up to 820 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, but Luckin's actually profiting now-third quarter profits up to eight hundred twenty million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckin is also struggling to make money its loss widened in the third quarter to $82 million (see details here).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So they crashed, but somehow they're making money again? That turnaround is just bizarre.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they crashed, but somehow they're making money again? That turnaround is just bizarre.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, after that 95% share price fall since May. Started at 3000 a share!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, after that ninety five percent share price fall since May. Started at three thousand a share!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares in Luckin, which was founded in only 2017 and is headquartered in the southeastern Chinese city of Xiamen, have now climbed more than 59% since the company went public in May this year at a price of $17 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And all this from a company headquartered in Seattle, of all places. The whole story feels surreal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this from a company headquartered in Seattle, of all places. The whole story feels surreal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares in Luckin, which was founded in only 2017 and is headquartered in the southeastern Chinese city of Xiamen, have now climbed more than 59% since the company went public in May this year at a price of $17 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. From riches to ruins, almost overnight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. From riches to ruins, almost overnight.
